programme.title: Tien jaar Terug
programme.desc: In Tien jaar Terug duiken we in het Eredivisieverleden. In het seizoen 2015-2016 gaat PSV onder leiding van Phillip Cocu proberen de landstitel te prolongeren. Bij concurrent Ajax keert clubicoon John Heitinga terug en wordt de portemonnee getrokken voor Amin Younes, Nemanja Gudelj en Arek Milik. Feyenoord versterkt de aanval met Colin Kazim-Richards, Eljero Elia en Michiel Kramer.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Go Ahead Eagles is bezig aan een nu al historisch seizoen. De club is regerend bekerwinnaar én reuzendoder in de Eredivisie en Europa League. De opmars van rood en geel is te zien in een gloednieuwe reeks van Home of Eus, de documentaireserie van Özcan Akyol (Eus). In de eerste aflevering onderzoekt Eus hoe Go Ahead Eagles zich klaarmaakt voor het grootste seizoen uit haar clubhistorie. En dat terwijl 'Kowet' nog maar zeven jaar geleden bivakkeerde in de kelder van de Eerste Divisie.

programme.title: ESPN Film
programme.desc: De verwachtingen in Colombia waren hooggespannen voor het WK voetbal van 1994. Maar toen aanvoerder Andres Escobar tien dagen na zijn eigen doelpunt werd doodgeschoten, was zijn lot voor altijd verbonden aan dat van zijn naamgenoot, drugsbaron Pablo Escobar.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: NFL Highlights
programme.desc: In NFL Highlights komen wekelijks alle hoogtepunten uit de laatste speelronde in de NFL voorbij.

programme.title: Tien jaar Terug
programme.desc: In Tien jaar Terug duiken we in het Eredivisieverleden. In het seizoen 2015-2016 gaat PSV onder leiding van Phillip Cocu proberen de landstitel te prolongeren. Bij concurrent Ajax keert clubicoon John Heitinga terug en wordt de portemonnee getrokken voor Amin Younes, Nemanja Gudelj en Arek Milik. Feyenoord versterkt de aanval met Colin Kazim-Richards, Eljero Elia en Michiel Kramer.

programme.title: Tekengeld
programme.desc: In deze podcast bespeekt Yordi Yamali met een gast alles over de wereld van in- en uitgaande transfers, makelaars en alle andere ontwikkelingen in het voetbal.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: Voetbal Geeft
programme.desc: Paul (59) gaat gebukt onder eenzaamheid. Via het project Voetbalmaatjes bij AZ wordt hij gekoppeld aan Erik, met wie hij naar elke thuiswedstrijd van AZ gaat. Er groeit een vriendschap op en het helpt Paul uit zijn isolement. Nu mogen ze tijdens een wedstrijd van AZ de bal naar de middenstip brengen en de toss verrichten.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: How The Ryder Cup Was Won
programme.desc: A look back at The 1995 Ryder Cup at Oakhill Country Club. America were the holders and Europe had only won once on US soil. Bernard Gallacher was to make amends.

programme.desc: Highlights from Sky's series of masterclasses with leading golf professionals.

programme.title: School of Golf

programme.title: Playing Lessons: Nick Dougherty
programme.desc: Former and current pros take viewers behind the ropes on the course, discussing such things as shot setup, club selection, and strategy. Here, Nick Dougherty delivers the lesson.

programme.title: Playing Lessons: Patty Tavatanakit
programme.desc: Former and current pros take viewers behind the ropes on the course, discussing such things as shot setup, club selection, and strategy. Here, Patty Tavatanakit leads the lesson.

programme.title: Nick Dougherty's Tee Time Tips
programme.desc: Sky Sports Golf pundit and former European Tour star Nick Dougherty provides a special set of Tee Time Tips from The 149th Open Championship at Royal St George's Golf Club, England.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The final day of the BMW Australian PGA Championship - forming part of the DP World Tour's Opening Swing for the new season - at Brisbane's Royal Queensland Golf Club. (30.11)

programme.title: Legends Tour Golf Magazine
programme.desc: Follow each stop on the Legends Tour season, beginning in Marbella and culminating in India. Here, a look at the Legend Tour's first visit to Cambodia for the Vattanac Legends Championship.

programme.title: Golf Academy: Lanto Griffin
programme.desc: Professional golfers give advice on how to improve your game across all aspects, from the tee to the green. Here, former PGA Tour winner Lanto Griffin gives some tips.

programme.title: Golf Academy:Kelly Feel Your Swing
programme.desc: Professional golfers give advice on how to improve your game across all aspects, from the tee to the green. Here, former PGA Tour winner Jerry Kelly on feeling your swing.

programme.title: Nick Dougherty's Tee Time Tips
programme.desc: As winter descends, hear from former professional Nick Dougherty as he shares his Tee Time Tips to help you improve your game out on the golf course.

programme.title: Best of The Openzone
programme.desc: A look at the best moments from The Open Zone at Royal Troon in 2016, with masterclasses and demonstrations from some of golf's finest players.

programme.title: Best of The Openzone
programme.desc: A look at the best moments from The Open Zone at Royal Birkdale in 2017, with masterclasses and demonstrations from some of golf's finest players.

programme.title: Best of The Openzone
programme.desc: Remember the best moments from the 2018 Sky Sports Open Zone, with interviews and golf tips from around the golfing world at The Open at Carnoustie Golf Links.

programme.title: The Golf Fitness Show
programme.desc: An often-overlooked part of golf, fitness can improve your game in all sorts of ways. The Golf Fitness Show demonstrates the perfect exercises for the course.

programme.title: Mark Roe's Short Game School
programme.desc: Former European Tour player Mark Roe travels to Trentino in northern Italy to give tips to the amateur golfer on how to improve their short game.

programme.title: Legends Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The Legends Tour season continued with the Champions UK plc European Senior Masters, staged at La Manga Club in Murcia, Spain.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Andalucia Costa Del Sol Open de Espana, the climactic event of the Ladies European Tour season taking place at Real Guadalhorce Club de Golf.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The final day of the BMW Australian PGA Championship - forming part of the DP World Tour's Opening Swing for the new season - at Brisbane's Royal Queensland Golf Club. (30.11)

programme.title: Beyond The Scorecard
programme.desc: After losing his mother to lung cancer, Josh Simpson shares how golf became his outlet as he attempts to break the world record for most courses played in a year. (1 of 5)

programme.title: Asian Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the PIF Saudi International - taking place at Riyadh Golf Club - on the Asian Tour, the official sanctioning body for professional golf in the region.

programme.title: On The Bubble
programme.desc: ...Fighting for Their Future. Following four players at the Genesis Championship on the brink, fighting to keep careers and futures afloat, this is golf at its most human and raw level.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from RSM Classic, a PGA Tour event held at Sea Island Golf Club. Maverick McNealy collected his first tour win here in his 142nd start a year.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Andalucia Costa Del Sol Open de Espana, the climactic event of the Ladies European Tour season taking place at Real Guadalhorce Club de Golf.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Learning Centre
programme.desc: From instruction tips for your game, to fitness advice and lifestyle lessons, hear from the best on the circuit in PGA Tour Champions Learning Centre.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from RSM Classic, a PGA Tour event held at Sea Island Golf Club. Maverick McNealy collected his first tour win here in his 142nd start a year.

programme.title: Chronicles Of A Champion Golfer Darren Clarke
programme.desc: As a child, Clarke longed to be The Open champion. As a veteran, against all odds, he succeeded. This is an emotional story of a golfer refusing to give up on his dream.

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer...
programme.desc: A look at one of The Open's great champions. Here, the focus is on Paul Lawrie, who famously won The Open at Carnoustie in 1999 after a sensational comeback in the final round.

programme.title: The Open Films: Harrington 2008
programme.desc: Sky Sports looks back at some of the best contests at The Open. Here, the focus is on The 2008 Open at Royal Birkdale - Padraig Harrington returned as the defending champion from 2007.

programme.title: Nedbank Golf Challenge 2013 Hlts
programme.desc: Day four of the Nedbank Golf Challenge from the Gary Player Country Club in Sun City, South Africa. Jamie Donaldson was three shots clear at the end of day three.

programme.title: Hero World Challenge 2016 Hlts
programme.desc: Action from the Hero World Challenge on the PGA Tour from the Bahamas. Last year, Bubba Watson seized the title by a three-stroke margin ahead of compatriot Patrick Reed.

programme.title: Golf Academy: S Lyle Full Swing
programme.desc: Two-time Major champion and Hall of Famer Sandy Lyle gives you his tips for success on the course. This lesson is dedicated to achieving a perfect swing.

programme.title: Golf Academy
programme.desc: Some of golf's top professionals share their tips and advice for improving your game, from new starters to scratch golfers. Here, superstar Rory McIlroy is on hand with some advice. Part 1.

programme.title: Women's Open Masterclass
programme.desc: Ahead of the year's final women's Major at Carnoustie, join 2018 champion Georgia Hall, Emily Pedersen, Annabel Dimmock and Solheim Cup captain Catriona Matthew for insight into their game.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2025 Chevron Championship - the first women's Major of the 2025 season - taking place at the Club at Carlton Woods in Texas.

programme.title: U.S Women's Open Golf R4 Hlts
programme.desc: The final round of the 2025 US Women's Open, the second women's Major of the 2025 season. Maja Stark of Sweden looks to defend her lead with top-ranked Nelly Korda in contention. (01.06)

programme.title: Women's PGA Championship Hlts
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2025 KPMG Women's PGA Championship, taking place at Fields Ranch in Frisco, Texas. (22.06)

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 KPMG Women's Irish Open on the Ladies European Tour. Annabel Dimmock claimed the win at this event last season.

programme.title: Evian Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The final round of the Amundi Evian Championship, Europe's only women's Major, in Evian-les-Bains, France. Japanese golfer Ayaka Furue celebrated her first Major victory last year. (13.07)

programme.title: Women's Open Golf Final Round Hlts
programme.desc: Just three shots separate the top seven - led by Japan's Miyu Yamashita - as 18 holes remain at the Women's Open in Wales. England's Charley Hull forms part of the chasing pack. (03.08)

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 PIF London Championship, a Ladies European Tour event taking place at Centurion Club in St Albans.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 Aramco Houston Championship, as Golfcrest Country Club stages the mixed-format event for the first time.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 VP Bank Swiss Ladies Open, an LET event at Golfpark Holzhausern in Ennetsee, Switzerland. Alice Hewson of England claimed the win a year ago.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the La Sella Open, a Ladies European Tour event taking place in Spain.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 Aramco China Championship at Mission Hills Golf Club in Shenzhen, China.

programme.title: HotelPlanner Tour Golf
programme.desc: HotelPlanner Tour highlights from the season-ending Rolex Grand Final at Club de Golf Alcanada in Mallorca.

programme.title: Beyond The Scorecard
programme.desc: After losing his mother to lung cancer, Josh Simpson shares how golf became his outlet as he attempts to break the world record for most courses played in a year. (1 of 5)

programme.desc: The final day of the BMW Australian PGA Championship - forming part of the DP World Tour's Opening Swing for the new season - at Brisbane's Royal Queensland Golf Club. (30.11)

programme.title: You Can Play Golf
programme.desc: The story of four unique individuals, each of whom have overcome major obstacles to realise their ambition of simply playing golf. Hosted by three-time Major winner Padraig Harrington.

programme.title: Live DP World Tour Featured Groups
programme.desc: Join the featured groups as the DP World Tour's Opening Swing gets underway with first-round action from the Australian Open at Royal Melbourne Golf Club.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a battle of generations, two of the all-time greats Roger Federer and Andre Agassi fought for the year-end championship in 2003. Federer was aiming for his first title on American soil.

programme.title: ATP Final: Madrid
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper steps on court for the Madrid Open final aiming to lift his second Masters 1000 crown, as the 23-year-old faces 14th seed Casper Ruud for the first time. (04.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Athens
programme.desc: A win away from securing a dream debut appearance at the ATP Finals, Lorenzo Musetti must overcome Novak Djokovic to book his spot in Turin. Djokovic eyes his 101st title in Athens. (08.11)

programme.title: WTA Finals
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina - both undefeated in Riyadh - bid to become a first-time WTA Finals champion. This is the 14th meeting between the two, with Sabalenka 8-5 ahead. (08.11)

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: During his eighth appearance at Flushing Meadows, former British men's number one Cam Norrie's US Open campaign continued against 24-year-old Argentinian Francisco Comesana.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Crowned Australian Open champion earlier in the year, sixth seed Madison Keys began her 2025 US Open bid on Arthur Ashe Stadium against Mexican Renata Zarazúa.

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Montreal
programme.desc: Rising Canadian star Victoria Mboko's miracle Montreal run continues as the 18-year-old meets four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka in her first tour-level final. (07.08)

programme.title: Indian Wells: Draper v Rune
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.desc: Highlights from the 2023 Ultimate Tennis Showdown Grand Final, held at the ExCel London.

programme.title: UTS 2024 Final
programme.desc: Highlights from the 2024 Ultimate Tennis Showdown Grand Final, held in London.

programme.title: ATP Final: Shanghai
programme.desc: It's a family affair in Shanghai as cousins Valentin Vacherot and Arthur Rinderknech vie for the penultimate Masters 1000 title of 2025. Vacherot stunned Djokovic to get here. (12.10)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In the 1996 Indian Wells final, Steffi Graf - having made her competitive return after a four-month injury layoff - would compete with Spain's Conchita Martinez for the title.

programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in the final of the China Open - a WTA 1000 event. (05.10)

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Daniil Medvedev competes in opening-round action against Frenchman Benjamin Bonzi. Amid a modest run of form, can former world number one Medvedev recapture the magic of his 2021 triumph?

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Two-time US Open champion Venus Williams makes her Flushing Meadows return with an opening-round encounter against the 11th seed Karolina Muchova under the Arthur Ashe lights.

programme.title: ATP Finals: Turin Final
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz faces Italy's reigning ATP Finals champion Jannik Sinner in their sixth meeting of the year, marking the finale to the 2025 Tour season in Turin. (16.11)

programme.title: Tennis 2025 Season Review
programme.desc: With both the WTA and ATP Finals in the history books, enjoy a full review of the 2025 season.

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: Madrid: Draper v Paul
programme.desc: British number one and world number six Jack Draper targets the Madrid Open quarter-finals in a clash with the 11th seed Tommy Paul of the United States. (30.04)

programme.title: Madrid: Draper v Arnaldi
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper eyes the Madrid Open final four and world-number-five status as the 23-year-old faces Italy's Matteo Arnaldi. Draper dispatched Tommy Paul in the last 16. (01.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: WTA Rome 2025 Review
programme.desc: A review of the 2025 Internazionali BNL d'Italia, a WTA 1000 clay-court event held at the Foro Italico in Rome.

programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.desc: The United States' Taylor Fritz, a runner-up in Flushing the year before and the last American standing, met the 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic in the quarter-finals.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Coco Gauff gets underway in New York as the 2023 women's singles champion plays former quarter-finalist Ajla Tomljanovic of Australia. The pair last met in the Paris Olympics.

programme.desc: It's a family affair in Shanghai as cousins Valentin Vacherot and Arthur Rinderknech vie for the penultimate Masters 1000 title of 2025. Vacherot stunned Djokovic to get here. (12.10)

programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.desc: Jack Draper's hunt for a first ATP 1000 title continues, as the men's British number one goes up against home favourite Ben Shelton at Indian Wells. (13.03)

programme.desc: Six-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek faces Jasmine Paolini for the Cincinnati title. In what will be Swiatek's 13th WTA 1000 final, Paolini is competing in just her third. (18.08)

programme.desc: Coco Gauff awaits compatriot Jessica Pegula, fresh from ending Aryna Sabalenka's 20-match winning run, in an all-American Wuhan final. The pair meet in their first final together. (12.10)
